Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had the best two years of my life at brown thus far. It has given me the tools and the opportunities of pursuing my dreams
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Classes are amazing, and professors are passionate about their fields. Classes tend to be smaller, which helps you form bonds with classmates and professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Of all of the colleges to which I applied, Brown was the only one that felt like home. If anything, I'd wish I applied Early Decision!
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Classes range from small to large, professors are engaging, students are fascinating and contribute to the learning experience, and work is hard but useful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The classes, student body, and energy is amazing
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Even in my largest classes, professors clearly love teaching. They all want you to learn and succeed, and they will do everything in their power to make it happen.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Come into it with an open mind. No school is perfect and there is a range of personalities to meet.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've had a pretty great first semester. Brown itself isn't the greatest institution; the student body has made the Brown experience for me. Brown needs to work on its diversity action plan and actually listen to the students of color if it wants to strive to be an actual inclusive school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I ended up not really liking the classes I took this semester. I think part of that was having expectations that differed from the realities of those courses. I am really excited for the classes I am taking next semester, however. There is certainly no guarantee that you'll be in a small class your freshman year unless you enroll in a first year seminar course.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fraternities are generally open to the general student populace for events and there isn't much differentiation between non-Greeks and Greeks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students are generally interested in athletics, but it's really not as big as at some other comparable schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not diverse, but don't let that dissuade you, it's by far the most accepting Ivy League school
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I would say fan support is supplied mostly by parents/family members but not a large portion of the student body will turn out for a particular team.  Team performance for a number of our sports is not the best, but the athletic facilities that they train in are top notch.  Granted, I have only been to football/rugby/basketball games, any other information I have only heard through word of mouth.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not too big so it is always an option but not a necessity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Although varsity sports aren't the most exciting the extensive interest in intramurals makes up for it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I love how Greek life always takes part in campus life, but is never too huge or messy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sport remains an integral part of campus life, though not as huge as in state schools. In stead of being overwhelmingly competitive, Brown holds an open and mild attitude toward athletes and instrumental players, so that no one is under great pressure but we simply enjoy sports as an exciting activity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are a variety of different frat and sororities with different emphases.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I do not frequently attend sport events and games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life on campus is minimal. Quite notable for their parties though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Has the most positive energy not just for brown students but for anyone interested in college athletics. There is an equal level of involvement from every member of the college.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly, Greek Life isn't that big here, and the partying scene at frats are mostly frequented by first years. Greek Life actually suffers under the backdrop of this school's liberal atmosphere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: My school does not have much emphasis on athletics. The athletic facilities for students are pretty nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The facilities are excellent, but the hours can at times be limited.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: About two frats that have the stereotypical frat vibe to them: DPhi and Sigma Chi. Its pretty easy to get in if you know people in the frats, and a little difficult but not impossible otherwise. However, a lot of greeks hang out with non-greeks and by no means does your status on campus raise by being in a fraternity or a sorority. Most of the sororities seem pretty typical to me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our lacrosse and hockey teams are very highly ranked. However, only about 40-50 students go to each of the home games. These numbers are about the same for the football games. Don't expect to be having any huge tailgates.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As a non-athlete, I know next to nothing about the athletics at school. Very few people pay attention to sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sometimes I forget that we have sports here...
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a part of campus life, but it is not  essential.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics at brown are important, but most students don't attend the events. Athletes are well treated and have access to the best coaches and facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sororities are becoming more popular on campus; therefore, it's getting more competitive to join one. I chose to rush and join a sorority because I could see the girls I met during the process becoming lifelong friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics aren't very popular overall, but you certainly decide your own level of involvement. Personally, I usually only go to athletic events when I know one of the players.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We are a diverse and liberal body as related to ethnic/racial diversity, and we are generally very accepting of people of all races, sexual orientation, and religion. However, there is a strong anti-conservative feeling on campus, and most of the student body is very liberal and vocal about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I like the greek life on campus and the people in it
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our football isn't great, but other sports are.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not really big here. A lot of chapters got disbanded/kicked off campus, so the parties are usually pretty low-key.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: No one really pays attention to then unless there is free gear involved. Club sports are super easy to get into though and they offer a good source of friendships.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletes only hang out with other athletes. They were involved in a cheating scandal on campus in the fall of 2015. Athletic facilities are pretty nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Almost all of the fraternities are suspended due to sexual assault cases.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: 55% of students do not receive financial aid - keep that in mind. Classism is real.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm pretty sure the sororities and fraternities on campus aren't allowed to throw parties at the moment. Otherwise, I don't know much about this area.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't really care about the athletic events on or off campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Brown University is VERY liberal-- in every sense of the word. There's few spaces where there isn't alcohol. It can be frustrating if that's not your thing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very relaxed but definitely addresses student concerns and makes us feel safe
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People-watching is so much fun...I'm so into so many of the guys and girls at this school. They're cool, confident, interesting, passionate, gorgeous and have hidden depths. Side note: I'm pretty sure niche is only letting me rank the guys--but that's so heteronormative (not to act out a Brown cliche)!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As a non-Greek, I love how it works here--there is a Greek system for those who want it, but I can completely ignore it/occasionally make fun of the frat bros and sorority girls. It is not at all necessary to be part of a frat/sorority to have a social life, nor is it completely ostracizing if you are part of one--I have lots of great friends who are in frats. There's a variety. Some of the frats throw really fun parties, whether they're in the housing provided by the school or in off-campus houses where senior frat members live. Getting into frats doesn't seem too difficult--I think mostly everyone who wants to join does. We also have great program housing that work similarly to the frats. The frats are housed in a gorgeous, super central area with great landscaping, nice rooms.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
So much freedom to do anything we want...parties do get shut down, but only when they're big, and it's usually the Providence police who crack down. My first weekend here, I was walking down the street with an open alcohol container--the Brown police (aka the Bro po) drove by and said "you probably want to put that away, you're not allowed to have open containers." I was glad I put it away because the Providence police (who are much stricter) drove by right after--thanks Bro po!

The administration is vocally a little stricter this year about student organizations throwing parties, but I don't know if student organizations (i.e. frats, clubs, program houses) have actually been prevented from serving alcohol, etc. at parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is pretty chill about alcohol/drugs. In certain situations, frats have gotten in trouble for serving alcohol to underage drinkers, but individuals can't really get in trouble for drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the time, Brown is very forgiving. In terms of protests, however, the university has not supported its students in the best way.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Many students are part of a team, but there are also a good number of students who are not part of a team and are unaware.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I tend to obey policies. I believe in doing things right.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The administration often does things that students don't agree with, but students petition or protest to change policies frequently and student voices are often heard.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: there isn't much talk about administrative policies in the social lives of people that i have heard. the most i have heard about are academic honesty and dorm rules about candles and cooking equipment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: some sports get better attention than others, but the students who DO attend are very enthusiastic. school spirit is very important of for the students who go to support the teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not a huge part of campus, but present
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Can feel separated from the student body
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are a lot of parties at the Greek houses, particularly the fraternities. There is no snobbery between Greeks and non-Greeks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Drinking and underage drinking is prevalent on Brown's campus as is marijuana use. It can be quite loud and distracting at times in the dorms, but I never feel pressured into joining drug and alcohol use.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: No one pays attention to the athletics at Brown. Occasionally, there is advertising for a sporting event, but more often there is not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not huge at Brown. A very small percentage of students are actually involved. That being said, Greek parties are widely attended by non-Greeks. Each Greek house has a building on campus, but nonGreeks can live on certain floors of the building as well. Greeks students aren't really perceived any differently than nonGreeks. it is very low-key.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's not easy to actually get in trouble at Brown. You have to be pretty stupid or basically looking for it. Brown Police is not out to get students, they really are just there to keep us safe. The only thing is that campus parties do get shut down a lot, but that's due to inevitable overcrowding and high noise levels of the better parties. Having visitors is incredibly easy. Nobody has to be notified- it's great because that seems like it would be a huge hassle. Cheating is taken very seriously, though it is known that in certain concentrations it happens quite a bit. Creating new student organizations is a process, but it is not difficult.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Many students are varsity or club athletes, or participate in intramural sports. Events are not widely attended, however. Usually the people who show up to events are participants' close friends and parents, maybe some community members. The athletic departments efforts to get people to come have not been very successful.

The athletic facilities are great, we have three main ones with a hockey rink, tennis courts (indoor and out) basketball courts, soccer and baseball fields, a large athletic center, huge indoor pool, and indoor and outdoor track. All the facilities are very nice and well kept, except for the smaller satellite gyms on other parts of campus. I think the majority of students take advantage of the athletic facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is the absolute best when it comes to campus strictness. So long as you are keeping yourself and others safe, you can basically do whatever you want and be whoever you want to be without any administrative or social pressure. Brown is only strict when it comes to honor code and safety issues, such as sexual assault incidents. Simply put: Brown is open to letting you be independent but will put its foot down when the situation calls for it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: One aspect that makes Brown unique is how liberal it is. They are very open to new ideas and to everyone. So starting new clubs, protests and demonstrations, and other ways to voice your opinion is almost unlimited. Brown is still strict with essential rules and policies, such as dorms and criminal activity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Brown students are famously attractive. However, the strong hook up culture means that many people seem not to be looking for long-term relationships.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most people at Brown would tell you that we are willing to discuss at length most types of diversity - in regards to race, religion, politics, sexuality, gender identity, etc. We remain hesitant to address socioeconomic status. To be clear, Brown is home to many lower-class and middle class students, making it very diverse. But like other top schools, Brown draws disproportionately from very wealthy families. This economic divide is the last taboo on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is a very liberal environment. Students don't need to go to any trouble to hide the fact that they've been drinking (even if they're underage) or smoking weed (they do it in surprisingly public spaces). Parking is enforced very strictly, but this affects mostly visitors and tourists (because most students don't have cars).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of us only ever consider Greek Life when choosing which frat party to go to over the weekend. Very few women are members of sororities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We like to joke at Brown that no one goes to the games except the alumni. However, we are home to many excellent D-1 sports teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Administration was there to help, not to make your experience worse.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Its the Ivy League, its not the SEC.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone here is different! I have met such different people from coming here & it is one of my favorite things about being here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is adherence by the honor code here at Brown. At college, you will be treated like an adult and be expected to act like one.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Greek life is not a crucial part of experiencing Brown. Yes, there is Greek life and it seems to be a very fulfilling experience but is low-key.

But Greeks= parties!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics is a part of life here but not everything- if you are interested in sports there is definitely a place for you, but Brown does not center around any specific activity but is rather a melting pot for all interests and passions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students in Brown are quite involved with different sports, it has a beautiful large fields and athletics facilities, and it organizes many events with other universities like Brown vs. Harvard last week, for the intramural sports, I enjoy swimming and playing Squash which give me a break from study
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is largely hands-off with most things, unless they begin to cause serious, dangerous problems. This is mostly a good thing, but sometimes it's too hands-off. For example, there have been a number of protests around racial issues and sexual assault issues that the school has not done too much to remedy. In other words, it's very lenient and accommodating, but sometimes it's hands-off against the students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
I don't partake in Greek life or party, but I have many of friends who do--I'll include their take on Greek Life here. Greeks throw many parties on the weekends that are (mandatory to be) open to all students. Greeks aren't incredibly clique-y, and non-Greeks don't have an opinion either way. Even if one wants to go to a party, there are plenty that aren't thrown by one of the Greek houses.

Greek housing is all concentrated in one quad, Wriston Quad, and I've been inside one of the houses. It's of average quality--nothing special, but nothing disgusting either. There are several houses and the Wriston area is actually quite beautiful.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of our sports teams are pretty subpar and we frequently lose games. That being said, Brown has outstanding school spirit and interest/involvement in sports, and supports its teams anyway. The athletic facilities are extremely accessible and of high quality.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Definitely pretty girls and nice looking guys. There is a place called Jo's that serves chopped salads for dinner and most dorms have a gym/gym nearby, so it is easier than it is at many places to keep fit if you want to. I don't know as many girls who put on pounds at Brown compared to schools at home, so that definitely enhances attractiveness. Only complaint is again that there are so many more gay boys than girls, so dating is extremely competitive for girls. It is good for the straight guys (esp straight athletes/frat guys who are attractive), because there will always be a line of too many ladies, but definitely not optimal for us girls!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: They throw awesome parties! There are the houses on campus that throw major parties/for freshmen, and then the houses off campus that older students generally attend
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review:
the administration is so bad! Getting them to respond to anyone's needs is an uphill battle, and they definitely are more liberal than the average Brown student- which means that if you have the slightest depression they can send you away for a year, if you're accused of sexual assault you're presumed guilty and punished, or if you want your place advertised as a summer sublet there's a good chance they will simply forget to advertise it and be unresponsive when you complain about it. All of those things have happened to people I know. Apparently Brown forgot to fill out a key question on US News college survey, resulting in very low rankings this year from that missed question. It doesn't surprise me that Brown would forget something like that, even though it's important to outside people. 

Most of the administration would have been great if Brown were the hippie-liberal-brainwashed school it was 15 years ago, but the students are now smart and sophisticated- which means that there's a lot of tension/hatred for deans and administrators. Although President Paxson is better at managing these things than Ruth Simmons was.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I love the sports teams! They really keep the campus together socially and throw some of the best parties. Many live off-campus, which is an advantage to the frats on campus parties, since they don't get broken up immediately. Attendance at sporting events isn't great- I went to like two games the whole time I was at Brown, even though I knew a lot of athletes!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the athletes are very nice people who are also pursuing concentrations in things like Engineering or Neuroscience. Brown in definitely not a dumb jock school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is very lenient as long as you are not putting yourself or others in serious danger. Health services will take care of drunk students with no repercussions for drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are a lot of parties at the Frat houses; however, students are super cool about it. No one necessarily cares if you go or not and there's a plethora of other ways to socialize if you aren't into Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Just don't get in trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Great if you were recruited to come here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's pretty lame but laidback. Not a big deal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone has unique personalities, looks, interests
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not in Greek life, don't seek it out, it doesn't seek me out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Certain groups of people are very involved in athletics, but it is not a cornerstone of overall student life.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not a huge influence on campus. It is mainly viewed (by non-Greeks) as the party supplier.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Hipsters and their imitators abound. You can pretty much wear anything you want.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Brown prides itself on its diversity and its students' ability to confront conflicts that arise out of these categories.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The administration treats students like adults. Students are responsible for knowing their own limits, but the university does provide help for those who might have estimated them incorrectly.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I'm a graduate student.  Athletics is not what I'm there for.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Brown could be more diverse, but compared to most other colleges, it is probably pretty diverse.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of our frats and sororities are kind of jokes, like really low-key, co-ed, and un-official, I think we only have like 4 or 5 stereotypical frats and sororities, and most people just think they're weird/insane. Greek organizations just live in certain dorms mixed in with other students, both independents and members of other frats/program houses.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I do not hear anything about our varsity athletics. I think we have some good teams but I'm not really sure. I've had athletes in my classes before but I'm not friends with any
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People here are smart, passionate, well-rounded, and hardworking for the most part. Sometimes the hard work gets in the way of other things; many people choose to spend their weekend nights working in the library, instead of going out and having fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our police department doesn't care about anything, one officer just laughed when he saw my friend smoking weed outside his dorm. I also know someone who had to go to the hospital after drinking too much, and he only had to go to a 1-hour session on safe alcohol consumption or something like that. You're pretty much allowed to do whatever you want at Brown, nobody really cares unless you're endangering anyone
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Brown Police (BroPo) are pretty chill.  They usually will only enforce things to keep students safe.  As long as you're being conspicuous with your alcohol/drug use, you shouldn't have a huge problem.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is extremely diverse!  You are bound to meet people from all walks of life (ethnic, sexual, religious, national).  Everyone is also very nice and accepting of differences.  In general, it's just really cool to learn in such a diverse, beautiful place!  If the College could improve, it would be in the areas of political and economic diversity though.  Most students are left-leaning, and in general, students are pretty well off (especially transfers and internationals, since Brown is need-aware for them).  That's pretty typical though
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: There is not much school spirit around the athletics at Brown.  With that being said, there is Greek Life, and some students are passionate about Brown athletics.  However, if you're looking for the big time, "ra-ra" sports feel, look elsewhere
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: The school clearly has rules, but it is also very hard to get in serious trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Games offer great options in the weekends, and the athletic facilities are average.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: You choose to get involved, and the Greek community is very inclusive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I love that the Greek life on campus is pretty low key. When you meet students who are Greeks, you know that being Greek is not what they're "all about." Being Greek is, undoubtedly, one of the many things they are involved in on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: As a student of color at Brown, I've felt that I've been met with nothing but acceptance.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are a fun, but minor, part of campus life
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Sport is good for our health. many students are athletics
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not very strict, but students know how to behave.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: One of the best qualities of this school
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I find that alcohol consumption will occur regardless of campus police influence. However, I feel it is far more important to have a strict honor code and to deal with protests and demonstrations adequately.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics is not very big or important here. Our varsity teams are okay. There is school spirit but losing a football game is not really a big deal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is a very diverse university. There are people of all ethnic/racial backgrounds, religious beliefs, and sexual orientation to name a few.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is present if you want to get in on it but there isn't much pressure to.  Themed parties thrown by the Greek house are popular and generally non-Greeks appreciate Greeks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You'll find people from all walks of life at Brown.  People generally welcome diverse backgrounds.  But do be wary of a tendency to cling to popularly and exculsively liberal takes on issues.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students are tasked with the responsibility to make their own decisions and deal with the repercussions.  School police are not present to get students in trouble but moreso to ensure students' safety and well-being.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit is present but sport culture is not that typical.  As a school, certain teams do better than others.  Athletic facilities aren't awesome but they are sufficient and very convenient and accessible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students are very, very attractive and you can generally find a hook up with ease.  There are relationships, flings, dating and combinations of these present.  In terms of dress, people typical have good fashion sense but students are free to express themselves however much they'd like.  Similarly, individuals are pretty friendly and open to new interactions with many new people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not an athlete, so I can't really speak here, but the new facilities seem superb!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I live in a program house which I love! Brown isn't really about the Greek life, but it's definitely an option if it's something you actively want to be involved in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is very very lenient! The protest questions is a little awkward...
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As a member of Greek life, it's a huge part of my social, professional, and academic life.  Greek life does a lot for its members, but is generally regarded neutrally by rest of campus. Greek life is definitely the center of the party scene on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity is a huge priority at Brown.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit and support of varsity athletics are limited.  However, athletic facilities and intramural sports are hugely popular with all students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't very big on campus but they do throw most of the parties. People do not hold Greeks on a higher social status.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity in general is rampant here. You are bound to meet someone who you would never have thought you'd meet.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: School policies aren't very strict or severe unless something really dire happens.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are some great varsity and club teams, but games are generally poorly attended and some sport teams need work.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diverse in every way except for political beliefs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration and law enforcement generally respect the student body and will allow you to make smart decisions for yourself.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of attractive people, especially for a top-tier school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The frats throw a lot of great parties, but aside from that are relatively nondescript and nonintrusive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Only thing that's missing is political diversity. There are a few conservatives here and there but Brown is overwhelmingly liberal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Don't come here if you want a classic sorority/ fraternity college experience. Most students don't join in on Greek life, but the frats DO host most weekend parties. Depends what crowd you fall into.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Honestly, if you aren't an idiot about your drug and alcohol use you'll be fine. Students frequently smoke openly in freshman quads, and our floor RCs generally know we smoke/ drink. 
The BEST thing about Brown is the anonymous EMS service. Your teachers, parents, future employers will never, ever find out you got EMS'd that one Saturday night after throwing back too many shots of Jungle Juice. Very safe.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Brown is the most accepting campus around-- don't worry about being looked over or looked down upon. You'll 100% find your niche here- or at least a great group of people to hangout with!
Absolutely accepting on sexuality issues.

There is an emphasis to be liberal here; leave your Romney bumper sticker at home.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You can do what you want here, if you are good about it. Many people use drugs and consume alcohol (even underage) in the dorms and RAs are mostly okay with it as long as it isn't too obvious to anyone who would pass by.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Games are fun to attend with friends and students are encouraged to go (free)! But there is not always a great show of school spirit except to important games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Really nice people. Variety of styles and interests. It's impossible not to find a group to fit into (or a dozen).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most people on campus are involved in athletics, but there is limited fan support.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a zero tolerance for underage drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: You find all types of people of all gender identities who are passionate, interesting, and eager to make friends or at least have casual conversation. Social life and dress varies from one person to the next but you can always find someone to match your interests. The only thing holding back an A+ is that about halfway through the first semester cliques become more pronounced so patterns of behavior tend to solidify.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Police are pretty strict about breaking up large parties, but Brown is mostly relaxed.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Brown students are almost completely lacking in school spirit.  Almost nobody goes to athletic events, other then possibly when we play Harvard in football.  However, the intramural sports are a lot of fun, and we have several very nice gyms across the campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Frats are there if you want them, but they don't dominate the social scene.  The parties are open to anyone, although they sometimes charge a cover
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is infamous for its liberal atmosphere, which very truly allows students freedom to do whatever they wish in dorms and around campus. The downfall to this freedom is that students are given rights without responsibility--this plays very negatively when dorm parties or events disrupt the living environment for other students who may be studying, sleeping, or who simply wish to not feel threatened or violated when walking through hallways reeking of beer, strewn with garbage, or littered with hanging wires from exit signs broken by other, less considerate students. The fact that there are no ramifications for behavior disrespectful to other students in dorms (the behavior is hardly addressed to begin with), it continues and escalates through the year.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Sports are popular, but not anywhere near the level of many state schools or even other schools of similar stature. Despite this, a big swath of the student body participates in athletics, formally or informally, and in generally, students are very active and physically involved.

Facilities are good, but can always be improved. Issues are addressed quickly. School spirit is a bit lacking, as most students tend to focus more on their studies and social activities more so than attending some sport events. However, the more popular sports, like football or soccer, attract very large crowds. Most sports team across numerous disciplines do very well on a national level. A few Brown students have even performed at Olympic events.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The variety of social backgrounds and experiences in the student body make Brown University an incredibly vibrant and active place. Students are very hard-working, but also take social activities and partying as seriously as their future careers, as it is important to also have fun!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I literally feel like a minority being white and heterosexual and relatively economically privileged here. Brown celebrates diversity more than any other institution I've visited in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Non Greeks make up the majority of students and they go to frat parties every now and then but don't pay much attention to it otherwise
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Most people are not ready to dedicate a huge chunk of time to playing for the school's team so a lot of kids actually choose this route.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a a lot of spirit and the kids are generally excited about sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The social scene is pretty nice. A great variety of people to be involved with. I would say that overall there are just as many couples as there are single people. The ratio isn't heavy to one side or the other, so the social scene is great. The girls aren't stuck up, and the guys aren't usually jerks
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Frats are not a very prominent part of life at Brown.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse, and most everyone is accepting and open-minded. :) There is a group for everyone here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Brown University is a liberal institution, which is not only reflected in the open curriculum, but also in the diversity of students in terms of ethnicity, sexual orientation, and religion. Students have varying beliefs and values, but they share the same all-inclusive and curious demeanor that epitomizes the open-minded Brown student. Students engage in intelligent conversations about oppression, discrimination, and inequality inside and outside of the classroom, ultimately providing people with greater knowledge of the experiences of their peers and leading them to make attitudinal changes. Be prepared to have your existing beliefs/notions challenged over and over again!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse and people are accepting of each other.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is a very liberal school in all sense of the word. Students are pretty serious about their studies too. That being said, drinking is frowned upon, as is academic cheating or plagiarism. These are very serious offenses, and will result in sanctions. For instance, two students who collabortated on a project and wrote similar answers were sent letters and had to see an academic honesty review board -- even though the prof had told them it was ok to work together! Be careful and do you own work and make sure everything is in your own words!
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: I'm over satisfied with the school. The instructors, administrators, and career services make life so easy for everybody at the school. They've helped me so much I can't help but love this school!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not very prominent at Brown.  There are many parties on the weekends, but one does not hear about community events as often.  There are only a few Greek houses so it is not a big deal to join a frat at Brown.  Currently there are no sororities, but one is in progress of getting Greek status.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everything is accepted as being a spectrum including race, religion, sexuality, and gender and every group is well represented. People of all backgrounds feel safe and have different clubs/student groups that help them maintain and/or grow their identity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have had the lovely opportunity of meeting many people from all over this planet, and coming from Texas, it is mind-blowing to become acquainted with peers straight out of Nigeria, Switzerland, New York City, Canada, Australia, and Haiti. I rated the diversity at Brown University a B, however, because as many people of color that I have seen and come across, the school is still primarily White.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is there for parties and some other events, but it doesn't dominate at Brown. It's not a big deal if you are in a frat or sorority, and it is not a big deal if you never set foot in one. It's nice because you can go to frat parties, which can be fun, but it's not a status thing
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports at Brown University are rigorous, and sports events receive a lot of on-campus coverage. Many students attend these events, and Brown is known for its excellent crew teams, swimming teams and rugby.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek Life isn't extremely popular on Brown's campus. It's not serious if you're in a frat or sorority, and certainly doesn't create social status. Everyone is seen on an even level, and most people do it simply to live with their friends and nothing else. Also, with the current situation of many frats, they can't throw official parties without some reprimanding from the school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Many people are able to find a lot of different cultures, ethnicities and lifestyles within the walls of Brunonia. The LGBTQ group is very strong on campus, as well as political groups for all parties. The athletic teams also intertwine with this as well. Many people do not discriminate, and if they do, most of their friends reprimand them for doing so. It is a very open environment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are a lot of fun and exciting people here at Brown. While the student population is very diverse, it manages to be a collection of some of the most driven and intelligent people one can hope to meet. While you may not find most students in tabloids, both guys and girls are generally attractive. It is said that Brown is the most attractive Ivy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of diversity on campus. Diversity through country of origin, race, ethnicity, and sexuality.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our sports are decent, but the only problem is the lack of school spirit. People do go see the games, just not most people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I literally love Brown's DPS. They will call you out if you are being dumb (e.g. carrying a case of beer into a freshman dorm and being obviously underage -- I've had friends who have had to pour out all their precious Natty), but otherwise they really are pretty chill. Brown on 4/20 is a sight to behold, and DPS stands by so that the Providence police don't show up. That said, they DO do things. I lost my phone a while ago and they helped me out a bunch, and everything I've heard is consistent with that. Basically, they're on your side unless you're being totally belligerent.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review:
Whenever Ruth Simmons was in charge, the police were a lot less strict. But now that we have a new president, the whole campus experience has changed. Parties get broken up at 10:00, and you can't expect a party to go all night. But if you are having a smaller gathering in your room, then I can guarantee that the police probably won't bother you. 
If you are an idiot, get drunk, and try to climb up the side of a building to get to an open window or if you run around Keeney breaking down exit signs, you will get in trouble with the police, and this might affect your academic record (not your social live). 
If you get drunk and get sick enough to have to call for help, you will not get in much trouble. They really just want the students to be happy and safe. (:
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Girls are great and pretty attractive, well dressed. Guys, however, are harder. The problem is that Brown has really become a hub for smart, gay men. Think about it- of the other ivies, Brown and Columbia are really the only two that I would qualify as very accepting. Consequently, gay men seem to really flock here. I have nothing against that, but it makes it really hard for straight women to find a mate. Luckily I have a boyfriend, but my friends' first question when they see a cute guy isn't "is he single?" but "is he straight?" That's the reason I give Brown a B+ rather than an A or A-. The people here are great personally, and, if available, generally make excellent partners.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There to help with drinking issues (ie get someone to the hospital if they need to ), not to get you in trouble
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's fine, a presence if you want it, but not pervasive if you aren't into that. Don't come here if youre a girl looking for sororities though. there are only two, and they are not active or "cool," but frats are pretty well respected around campus generally. They throw decent parties too
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: They aren't strict at all. I have the freedom to not only create my own curriculum, but to do whatever I want. As long as you're respectful of others you won't find yourself in trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If the Campus Were a Dog, It'd Be a Mut – No one is the same. I always find myself wishing there was a camera nearby because I'm always finding myself in a group with varying race, ethnicity, nationality, socioeconomic status, and religious background. Because of this, we have a reputation for being a very liberal school, as we are aware of the extreme diversity in our school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sport Is Average, but There's Still a Community – Sports at Brown are not huge at all, but are nonetheless attended. Men's football and soccer, and women's rugby, are probably the most followed sports on campus. These include intramural, club, and varsity sports. To be honest, I don't know much about athletics at Brown, yet I know many things about the school. This alone should be a testament to Brown's underrated athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's Ok. It's definitely majority white students, but there are a lot of foreign students (since Brown doesn't have an English requirement) and a lot of Asians.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Pretty Diverse – Someone once explained Brown diversity like this

>Like any university, Brown has to make money, so you see the population of students that are white and rich, whose parents contribute to the school and who are admitted because of the financial contributions they can make here. However, aside from that population of students, the students here are very diverse in ethnic background and mindset. Here you find interesting people who do interesting things and come from interesting places. In this sense, brown is one of the most diverse schools in its peer group.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very Laid Back – Everything is acceptable at Brown.  The social life is vibrant but doesn't revolve around Greek Life that much.  There is a VERY large LGBTQ prescence and theres a lot about embracing your sexuality.  People work hard but also are super laid back and not overly incredible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not Strict – Brown is laid-back. You only get in trouble if you really do something deserving of it (i.e. smoking in front of a hallway fire alarm).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is very diverse! I enjoy the variety of different cultural and ethic groups that are on campus. This makes the campus extremely vibrant. The campus and its people are very excepting of everyone's differences. This is what makes our school so special and great! While, it is diverse, it can still improve on being ethnically and economically diverse a bit more. Being that it is an ivy, there are more wealthy white students.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Students Like Sports, but It's Not Their Sole Focus – Students are mostly supportive of sports teams when they are friends with members of the team. That said, the most students show up at a football or soccer game when Brown is playing Harvard. Brown has an exceptional men's soccer team and women's crew team; both of which have won NCAA championships in recent years. Athletic facilities are pretty well cared for and accessible. The school is currently building a new swimming facility.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Brown is not strict...at least to the best of my knowledge.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Great People – For the most part, the students at Brown are interesting, fun, attractive, and intellectually curious.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: On a varsity sport myself but we received very little support. On the other hand, our soccer team did great and everyone came out to cheer!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Super Diverse – Although some people might lambast the school for having a substantial number of white students, the school celebrates diversity. The school is accepting and has so many different people of color and from diverse backgrounds that you get to the point where you do not even notice it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not Too Intense – The campus strictness at Brown University is very lenient. There is a lot of underage drinking, which takes place in frats, sororities, dormitories, and the like. There is also quite a lot of drug usage. Marijuana is very popular and smoked pretty much everywhere. The campus officers are extremely helpful and are not all out to turn people in or ruin people's fun. Their main purpose is to ensure that Brown students remain safe.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Minority Perspective – A lot of the students here Jewish and Caucasian. That being said, I am a minority and have always felt welcome by pretty much everyone. I have yet to become heavily involved in African American oriented clubs and organizations, but they din't seem to have a very visible presence on campus she compared to the Jewish Hillel organization for instance.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Guys are hot although there is a clear divide between the athletes and the non athletes. All the girls on campus try to look presentable and do so with their own style. Both genders are very fit and into good health.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's a type for everyone, and it's often difficult to even say if one student belongs to one particular type of student because people tend to take on multiple identities, which is good, because  people are never as one dimensional as we think. Also, very hot boys and very pretty girls. Fashion varies across a wide spectrum, but majority of people don't wear sweatpants to class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There's a good mix of ethnicities here at Brown, and it's almost impossible to get by without knowing at least one international student. Brown students engage in race-related discourse very often, though this may not necessarily translate to real ethnic/racial understanding. It's more tolerance and talking about diversity rather than actual diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Anything but Normal – You'd find yourself straining to come up with the picture of the average Brown student--that's most likely because there probably isn't one. Guys and girls can range from hipster rags and hair die, to your typical New England khaki-shorts and flip flops, to street slum, to something worthy of an award show. All in all the student body is fairly attractive, but that could be because we've ruled out all options from the nearby universities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Generally isn't an issue. Serious problems if you're put on medical or mental leave, however.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I think about 11% of Brown is involved in fraternities or sororities. Fine by me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not many here care about organized athletics. Which is fine with me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: At Brown we have students from every state and country imaginable, but I still feel like I'm attending a predominantly white, predominantly upper-middle class school. Maybe it's because the Ivy League, wealth, and connections tend to go hand in hand. But other kinds of diversity-  sexual, religious- are especially alive. Kids here seem incredibly expressive about their identities, and are always willing to talk openly about them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sigma What? Greek life is there for parties and some other events, but it doesn't dominate at Brown. It's not a big deal if you are in a frat or sorority, and it is not a big deal if you never set foot in one. It's nice because you can go to frat parties, which can be fun, but it's not a status thing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: No one really pays much attention to sports at Brown, as it is with most ivy league universities. There's always the occasional basketball or football game that many people will attend out of the year, but overall sports are not of much significance expect to athletes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Attractive, If That's What You're Into – There are definitely some very attractive and stylish individuals at Brown, from a wide-ranging, diverse background of generally very open-minded people, so you're sure to find someone to your liking!  It's hard to categorize the general aesthetic, but there are a lot of "hipsters".  If you want a relationship, you can find one, but if you're looking to just hook up, you can find that, too.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Freedom at Its Best – Brown has a "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" policy when it comes to students' social lives.  For the most part, the university lets students be; the only exceptions are in instances of flagrantly illegal/ dangerous behavior.  It's just the right balance between taking care of students and letting students have fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Ivy League – It's the Ivy League. We're not super into sports. But the atheletes here love their time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not a Strong Presence – There are parties every month or so but greek life is not a big deal at Brown. No one really cares if you are in a frat or sorority; it's just another housing option.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Egh Its There – Greek life is there for parties and some other events, but it doesn't dominate at Brown. It's not a big deal if you are in a frat or sorority, and it is not a big deal if you never set foot in one. It's nice because you can go to frat parties, which can be fun, but it's not a status thing
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Meh and Mediocre – There's a wide range of personality types, so you can definitely find someone similar personality-wise. If you're part of a small personality-niche or you're picky about the people you hang out with, you might have to do a lot of searching to find a guy you can connect with. In terms of looks, Brown guys aren't great eye candy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Diverse in Some Ways More Than Others – Brown is an open and accepting place almost by definition. It is a core value of most of the student body. As such, no one will be made to feel unaccepted or "tolerated" by the student body. That said, in terms of sheer representation on campus, certain groups are more heavily represented than others. Brown has such a large and visible LGBT population, for instance, that it is nearly taken for granted that anyone could be LGBT--thus it is a very easy place to come out, relative to many other places. When it comes to socioeconomic diversity, on the other hand, the campus feels wealthy. Issues of class may make those from less privileged backgrounds feel uncomfortable. The renewed focus on financial aid after the economic crisis, however, is aiming to address this area. A wide range of views on religion and politics are represented on campus, though like most of the Ivy League, "godless liberals" certainly compose the majority of students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks Don't Dominate Campus Life, but It's Present – Brown's greek life is present, but it doesn't dominate life at Brown. Some greek houses throw awesome parties, and if you don't drink, you don't have to at these parties. Besides partying, the philanthropy of each Greek house is seen through the various activities held on campus, although it could be stronger. There are frats, sororities (including 2 Black sororities) and co-ed frats.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Hard to Find Decent Men – Hard to find decent men on this campus. They are either taken, gay or complete ass*****. Don't really expect to find your soulmate here, but it could happen.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Moderate Strictness – Most often, campus police monitor parties and exceptionally unruly behavior and don't interfere with students' usual activities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Top-Notch Sailing Team - Bravo! Brown University has a fantastic sailing team - consistently among the top ten in the country for both coed and womens, despite it's 'club varsity' status
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Exists, but Not Huge – There are several frats, but they're a pretty small part of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: No One Cares – Brown is not known for our sports - therefore no one really cares. Don't get me wrong, some of our teams are nationally ranked, so we do have good sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Not Strict – Brown is not strict whatsoever.

There is plenty of underage drinking and people are very rarely busted for it. On weekends, most of the parties are at the frat houses on Wriston Quad, and there is plenty of visible underage drinking, but you are unlikely to get in trouble for this.

The campus is also not strict about pot at all. However, if you do this outside, then you are more likely to get caught. Most people just smoke in their rooms, and the chances of getting caught for this are practically zero.

Also, unlike many other schools, the RA's here do not write up students or take away alcohol. They are there to give students advice and help students make good decisions. Overall, the school seems to be more interested in helping students make the right decisions rather than getting students in trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Could Be Better – There is diversity when it comes to student's backgrounds but not a big diversity on economic backgrounds or personalities. Not a big sexual orientation diversity either but very accepting of none heterosexuals.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: A Beautiful Rainbow – The typical student looks very comfortable. Everyone has their own distinct style, so there isn't an overwhelming need to fit in. The social life is always vibrant, there is always something going on. Interests vary, depending on lifestyles, gender, and where people are from. The relationships in the academic environment are respectful and always a learning experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not strict at all. No police arrests, no trouble, no adults watching over you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Pepople look diverse on the outside, but really people are very similar in the inside. I wish there was more (deeper, more meaningful) diversity, not just black and white, rich and poor.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Brunonians Are Lovely! People at Brown seem to be either single or in a long-term relationship. I'm not entirely sure how that happens. People at Brown are fantastic in general!!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: School Spirit – Many Brown students enjoy going to athletic events and games, but sports culture is not that big on campus. The athletes usually stick with other athletes. I personally haven't been to any sports related events yet at Brown.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks Aren't Huge – Greek life at Brown is not huge. Those who belong to the Greek life enjoy it and get to know each other and take advantage of the perks. For those who don't it is not a big deal, since it is a small deal, most social events do not revolve around it.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks Arnt Everything – Greek life is there for parties and some other events, but it doesn't dominate at Brown. It's not a big deal if you are in a frat or sorority, and it is not a big deal if you never set foot in one. It's nice because you can go to frat parties, which can be fun, but it's not a status thing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A Very Diverse School! Brown is an amazingly diverse campus! There are students from all over the world here, and there are many international students, which adds an interesting perspective to the university.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I Wish We Had More Team Spirit – I'm not an athlete, but I do like to go to certain sports games. Sometimes I find myself wishing the I went to a school that supported their teams more. Also, the satellite athletic facilities could use more machines.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of Cliques – The guys and girls at Brown tend to be quite cliquey; the pre-meds, artsy types, rich kids, and jocks tend not to intermix. The group that sticks out the most, though, is the athletes. Not only do they have an entirely different physique and level of physical attractiveness than all of the other students (partially due to the lower academic standard in the recruitment process), but they tend to adopt a "party" lifestyle, and tend to be markedly more politically conservative than the uber-liberals at Brown.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Superb academics with wonderful professors
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Absolutely incredible. Challenging academics but the challenge forces you to expand your ways of thinking and reach new depths of understanding.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: So many course options and the professors really care about the subjects.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Registration period can be stressful. Brown is not an easy school. Also, if you're someone who would prefer -/+ grading system, Brown doesn't offer that.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It's a smaller program so it's a closer community. Thanks to this there is a lot of opportunity to get involved in research. The workload is not bad at all and either way the courses are very interesting. The department's building is one of the nicest on campus- it has great offices, computer labs, study areas, and labs.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review:
Brown really does live up to its prestigious name when it comes to education. Answering this after completing one semester of college, I can truly say that I have learned an unbelievable amount since arriving here. Its science department is amazing. Its math department is amazing. (As an engineering major I cannot speak for other areas of concentration). The only criticism I have is for its engineering department. Its intro course is new and still undergoing some renovation issues, but higher level courses have a reputation for being amazing. If you are planning to be an engineer and can stand the first year, then the curriculum will be great.

In terms of choosing courses, we get a "shopping period." We can "sample" as many classes as we want during this period (usually the first two weeks into a semester) to get a feel for the class. After this period you can officially register for the course. This gives students the opportunity to really explore classes and to get to know them before deciding on whether or not to take the course.

Brown's open curriculum also gives you chances students at other schools do not receive. Aside from taking required courses towards your major and fulfilling a not-very-intense writing requirement, you can take literally any class you want to take and qualify for. This allows you really shape a college curriculum that you will love. This allows you to explore areas that you did not know you liked. Heck, it might even shape the major you eventually choose! All in all, Brown has an outstanding curriculum.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Brown is frequently ranked among the top three computer science programs in the country.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The neuroscience program is quite good at Brown. There is a lot of research going on on-campus.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Excellent academics are the cornerstone of a Brown education. The Open Curriculum distinguishes Brown from other top schools, allowing students to take any classes they want as long as they satisfy requirements for a concentration.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Brown does not allow you to declare a concentration (our word for "major") until your sophomore year. The process is pretty straightforward.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The neuroscience program is quite excellent at Brown.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The academics at Brown are very undergraduate-oriented. I have had no problem exploring the different departments for possible concentrations, and I even have a few friends creating independent concentrations. Brown's academic excellence is due to the open curriculum: outside of whatever concentration you choose, there are no required classes. This freedom, coupled with the resources Brown offers, is unmatched.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Brown has amazing academics- once you commit to a concentration there are plenty of resources to help you in whatever ways you might need.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Brown in one word is "unique" and this extends to academics. Every single students academic plan will differ from the next thanks to the open curriculum.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The PhD study in Brown is a research focused program, it requires a hard commitment and involvement, where students are expected to publish papers and write a thesis, it takes about 5 years to finish it, the good thing is that the university gives you a guaranteed financial support for the 5 years
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: It is easy to get involved in the research program for Physics and the equipment and facilities are more than decent.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: With the Common Application, the application process is very smooth.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Students have to be active about finding internships. If you are, they are relatively easy to get.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Brown has a lot of academic opportunities available.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Seminar classes are often hard to get into, but if you keep trying you'll often be able to get one. You'll get the occasional bad professor, but for the most part, professors are great. They really want to get to know their students and always encourage people to come to their office hours. The open curriculum lets you really explore all different departments and take classes that you enjoy.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I have not yet declared a major, but I have not heard of anyone's having issues declaring one. I don't think there are any majors you have to apply to get into (except an Independent Concentration, which you have to get approved for), usually it's just if you want to major in something and can pass the required classes then you're fine.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There are notable alumni and the school's names can help your career.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The major has a good balance of courses, and feel that it will prepare me for a career in Public Health.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I am an Independent Concentrator at Brown, which means that I designed my own major. This experience of creating my own field to explore has been empowering, worthwhile.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The New Curriculum, in many ways, defines academics at Brown. Freedom to explore fields without general requirements has been incredible.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Internship opportunities at Brown, for me, have been wonderful. Good pay, medium time commitment, and reasonable responsibilities.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I decided to be an Independent Concentrator at Brown, which means I designed my own major. I have absolutely loved the flexibility, freedom, and power over my own learning this has provided me.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: A lot of flexibility, interdisciplinary majors. Majors in almost every subject imaginable.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: It was very stressful and competitive, but the website and admissions officers answered many doubts.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: The registration is a bit of a process but you can typically get into any class during the two-week shopping period.  Professors can range from amazing to boring.  Similarly, the workload depends on the course and department.  Typically you get what you put into a class.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Internships not required and cannot earn credit, but most students get them in the summers, rather easily.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Lots of opportunities, flexibility, professors always willing to talk with students.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Flexibility of academic system allows for experimentation and intellectual growth without crippling pressure or stress.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Awesome department that cares about all students.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I have not had an internship yet but most opportunities that students get are wonderful and help them to realize what career path they wish to take.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It is not a usual concentration offered at most universities or colleges. The professors are wonderful and the classes are engaging. The workload isn't as intense as other science concentrations.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors and classes are some of the best offered in the nation. The curriculum is wonderful because we are able to explore diverse areas of study that aren't part of our concentrations.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great undergraduate education -- arguably the best in the world. The open curriculum is amazing and I highly recommend taking advantage of it. Most professors are really nice and have office hours. Unlike other schools, professors teach most of the classes (with the exception of languages and econ, where there is a lot of TA lecturing). Some classes have TAs but they are just there as a resource.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Brown University students frequently get internships, and good ones too! Our professors are very focused on undergraduate teaching. Generally unpaid internships, and generally only available to sophomores +
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: No core requirements! We can take whatever classes we like as long as we fill our concentration requirements.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Lots of people are interested in political science and courses are popular and well taught. The workload is mostly reading but the opportunities are great.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I applied with the idea that I'd be doing another concentration and neither that one (biochem) nor my current one have a special admissions procedure. I haven't officially declared my concentration (major) yet but the process is pretty simple. I've already started taking necessary courses and briefly spoke with the physics concentration adviser regarding questions about particular courses. In my fourth semester I'll fill out the necessary paperwork and be accepted if all goes well.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Brown University is famous for its open curriculum which allows students to take control of their own education.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I love the Business Program and Education Program at Brown! Because we don't have general ed requirements and have flexible concentration requirements, I am able to take the classes that most interest me. The workload sometimes doesn't seem like work because I choose what classes I like.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The teachers always know what they are talking about ,although there are a few courses in which the professors can be hard to follow.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Brown is wonderful. All the opportunity one could ever ask for is offered; all you have to to is go out and get it.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: My concentration program is relatively small, but has an extremely excellent faculty and a great advisors. The classes are outstanding, challenging, and well-taught. The professors are always willing to help students in any way possible.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Brown University is one of two institutions in the country to offer a Public Humanities Masters Program.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Brown University is an ivy league institution with very high faculty standards.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore
